install_guide_markdown:
# Slax 15.0 Usage Guide

## Prerequisites
- 512 MB RAM minimum
- USB drive (1 GB+) for portable installation

## Note
Slax is designed to run from USB in your pocket. Fast, portable, and modular.

## Step 1: Download ISO
Download from official Slax website.

## Step 2: Create Bootable USB
Use Rufus, Etcher, or dd command.

## Step 3: Boot Slax
Boot from USB drive for instant portable desktop.

## Step 4: Persistence
Create persistent changes with save file feature.

install_steps.title: Download Slax ISO
install_steps.detail_md:
Download Slax 15.0 from the official website.

**ISO Size**: 280 MB  

Slax is a pocket operating system - small, fast, and portable.

install_steps.title: Create Bootable USB Drive
install_steps.detail_md:
Use a USB drive (1 GB or larger).

Slax includes built-in installer for Windows and Linux.

**WARNING**: This will format the USB drive.

install_steps.title: Boot Slax
install_steps.detail_md:
Insert USB and boot from it.

Slax loads into RAM and boots very quickly.

description: Slax is a modern, portable, small and fast Linux operating system with a modular approach. It fits in your pocket and boots from USB drive in seconds.
long_description: Slax is a Debian-based Linux distribution designed to be portable, fast, and modular. It's small enough to fit in your pocket (under 300 MB) and can run from a USB drive. Slax uses a modular system where applications can be added or removed as modules. The distribution boots quickly into a Fluxbox desktop by default, though KDE Plasma is also available. Slax allows persistent storage on USB, so changes are saved across reboots. It's ideal for system administration, data recovery, or having a portable Linux system that you can carry anywhere. The distribution emphasizes speed and simplicity.
